messages.subject: Re: Re: New file uploaded to SHQ + SAMURAI IN SALT LAKE
messages.msgSnippet: ... If you have access to the Bugei Ryuha Daijiten (by Watatani Kiyoshi), you ll find many lineages, including some members of the Shinsengumi. Also, I
messages.messageBody:
> Ofcourse I'm compiling the lineages from SErizawa
> Kamo's bio and
> other websites, old threads from here and ofcourse
> my messageboard
> but I was concerned how many guys cross trained in
> more lineage and I
> was concerned with getting a most complete list as
> possible....it's
> not because I'm lazy...I just really wanted to get
> this done sometime
> tomorrow (^_^).


If you have access to the Bugei Ryuha Daijiten (by
Watatani Kiyoshi), you'll find many lineages,
including some members of the Shinsengumi.

Also, I remember there was a Japanese website listing
all the styles practiced by the Shinsengumi members,
but I don't remember the link >_< Sorry...



=====
Serizawa Kamo

"I am the bone of my sword.
Steel is my body,and fire is my blood.
I have created over a thousand blades.
Unknown to Death.
Nor known to Life.
Have withstood pain to create many weapons.
Yet, those hands will never hold anyting.
So as I pray, unlimited blade works."

(Fate/Stay Night)



__________________________________
Do you Yahoo!?
All your favorites on one personal page � Try My Yahoo!
http://my.yahoo.com

messages.subject: Re: New file uploaded to SHQ + SAMURAI IN SALT LAKE
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you Barb for relaying the message (I can either open AIM or Explorer but not both...at the same time...I have bad computer karma) Ofcourse I m compiling
messages.messageBody:
Thank you Barb for relaying the message
(I can either open AIM or Explorer but not both...at the same
time...I have bad computer karma)

Ofcourse I'm compiling the lineages from SErizawa Kamo's bio and
other websites, old threads from here and ofcourse my messageboard
but I was concerned how many guys cross trained in more lineage and I
was concerned with getting a most complete list as possible....it's
not because I'm lazy...I just really wanted to get this done sometime
tomorrow (^_^).

I'm trying to reply to a kind of important email with someone...who
is very very very knowledgeable about martial arts....hopefully this
will spark his interest to the point he will delve deeper into
lineages represented in the Shinsengumi.
--------------------------------------------------
DURING THE SAME TIME PERIOD.....
"Samurai in Salt Lake" was about stranded nobles/samurai (from what
little info I have they were pro-shogunate as well but I don't know
if the person trying to get info can give me more details or not) in
UTAH...the small book was printed at WEBER STATE UNIVERSITY. The
same writer who compiled SAmurai in SAlt Lake wrote a thesis on the
Shinsengumi and I have yet to get his name and search the library
database for a copy....waiting...waiting...waiting (-_-)

messages.subject: Re: New file uploaded to SHQ
messages.msgSnippet: Just thought I d mention that... Anyone new to this list but not a member of Miburo Madness (an older version) should sign up for Miburo Madness, go to FILES
messages.messageBody:
Just thought I'd mention that...
Anyone new to this list but not a member of Miburo Madness (an older
version) should sign up for Miburo Madness, go to FILES and see
"Kyoto National Museum Exhibit"
which contains scans of sleeve insignias, Kondou's skull jacket, and
Hijikata's chain mail

Tiffany
SecretarytoCapt3
aka "badgerturtle"
